root.name: String Strip

example.code: a = ' ...here... ' # If no arguments are given strip() removes leading and trailing whitespace. a = a.strip() println(a) # Prints '...here...' aNoDots = a.strip('.') # Removes leading and trailing instances of '.'. println(aNoDots) # Prints 'here'

root.description: Retruns a copy of the string with leading and trailing characters removed -- whitespace by default. Given an optional argument, strip removes specific leading and trailing characters.

parameter.label: chars
parameter.description: an optional argument that removes specific characters
